item.title: Summer add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "For most of history, Anonymous was a woman." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Summer add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "You cannot find peace by avoiding life." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Summer add a quote by Tennessee Williams
item.description: "A prayer for the wild at heart kept in cages." -- Tennessee Williams

item.title: Summer add a quote by Tennessee Williams
item.description: "We are all civilized people, wich means that we are all savages at heart but observing a few amenities of civilized behaviour." -- Tennessee Williams

item.title: Summer add a quote by Tennessee Williams
item.description: "Yes, I have tricks in my pocket, I have things up my sleeve. But I am the opposite of a stage magician. He gives you illusion that has the appearance of truth. I give you truth in the pleasant disguise of illusion." -- Tennessee Williams

item.title: Summer add a quote by Tennessee Williams
item.description: "The violets in the mountains have broken the rocks." -- Tennessee Williams

item.title: Summer add a quote by Tennessee Williams
item.description: "We all live in a house on fire, no fire department to call; no way out, just the upstairs window to look out of while the fire burns the house down with us trapped, locked in it." -- Tennessee Williams

item.title: Summer add a quote by Lord Byron
item.description: "She walks in beauty, like the night Of cloudless climes and starry skies; And all that's best of dark and bright Meet in her aspect and her eyes..." -- Lord Byron

item.title: Summer add a quote by Vladimir Nabokov
item.description: "Our imagination flies -- we are its shadow on the earth." -- Vladimir Nabokov

item.title: Summer add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Summer add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "People living deeply have no fear of death." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Summer add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "How can a woman be expected to be happy with a man who insists on treating her as if she were a perfectly normal human being" -- Oscar Wilde
